LA140.name: Graphics and Two-Dimensional Design Studio
LA140.description: Graphic fundamentals, freehand and technical drafting, lettering, sketching and delineation, two dimensional principles and elements, orthographics.
LA140.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Horticulture or in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or in the Urban and Regional Planning major and open to undergraduate students in the Interior Design major or approval of school.

LA141.name: Graphics and Three-Dimensional Design Studio
LA141.description: Design process, 3-dimensional principles and elements, 3-D presentation techniques, color theory.
LA141.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Horticulture or in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA200.name: Introduction to Landscape Architecture
LA200.description: Environmental issues and problem-solving strategies within landscape architecture.

LA230.name: Site Construction Materials and Methods
LA230.description: Landscape architectural elements and principles of grading, drainage, construction materials and methods.
LA230.restrictions: Open to students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture and open to students in the Horticulture major or approval of school.

LA231.name: Landscape Site Engineering
LA231.description: Principles and procedures for landscape engineering of grading, site structures and systems.
LA231.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA242.name: Creating Space Studio
LA242.description: Landscape architecture design process, built and natural design elements. Small site scale.
LA242.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA243.name: Place Making Studio
LA243.description: Landscape architecture design process; human experience of place and environment; site scale
LA243.restrictions: Open to sophomores in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture.

LA311.name: Landscape Design and Management Specifications
LA311.description: Landscape design techniques, spatial organization, plant selection, plant and site interaction. Relationship between design, construction and maintenance. Preparation of planting and maintenance specifications.

LA332.name: Advanced Landscape Site Engineering
LA332.description: Advanced landscape engineering principles, technology, documents and procedures.
LA332.restrictions: Open to juniors in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA344.name: Connections of Scale Studio
LA344.description: Landscape architectural human and environmental connections - site to master planning scales, varying project complexity
LA344.restrictions: Open to juniors in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA345.name: Design Development Studio
LA345.description: Landscape architectural design and construction connections. Domestic and international practices.
LA345.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture.

LA368.name: Zoo Animal Biology and Conservation
LA368.description: Captive animal biology including illustrated examples of care, behavioral welfare and conservation work.
LA368.prerequisite: BS 162 or LB 144 or BS 182H or approval of department

LA369.name: Introduction to Zoo and Aquarium Science
LA369.description: Fundamentals of zoo and aquarium operations including research, interpretation, design, nutrition, captive breeding, conservation, ethics and management.

LA390.name: Landscape Architecture Field Studies
LA390.description: Field observation and analysis of selected professional offices, design and planning projects, natural areas, or places of historic interest. Background familiarization of selected study sites. Evaluation and synthesis of study experiences.
LA390.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of department.

LA421.name: Drawing as Knowing
LA421.description: Application of freehand drawing and digital colorization in the design process with an emphasis on urban and landscape subject matter.
LA421.restrictions: Open to students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA447.name: Juried Design Studio
LA447.description: Complex development projects, variable scale; juried projects; multiple stakeholders.
LA447.restrictions: Open to students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA448.name: Regional Environmental Design Studio
LA448.restrictions: Open to students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture or approval of school.

LA449.name: Landscape Architecture Design Studio
LA449.description: Self-selected evidence based design studio project.

LA480.name: Professional Practice in Landscape Architecture (W)
LA480.description: Principles and procedures of professional office practice. Organization and management of offices, personnel, and projects. Ethical and legal issues.
LA480.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LA480.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture.

LA489.name: Seminar in Zoo and Aquarium Science
LA489.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LA489.description: Scientific writing and oral presentations related to zoo and aquarium studies.

LA490.name: Independent Study
LA490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LA490.description: Individual investigation of landscape architecture topics in the interest areas of the Landscape Architecture faculty.

LA492.name: Senior Research Seminar (W)
LA492.description: Contemporary issues of relevance to the profession.
LA492.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.
LA492.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students in the Bachelor of Landscape Architecture.

LA494.name: Special Topics in Landscape Architecture
LA494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LA494.description: Selected subjects in landscape architecture derived from emerging issues and topics.
LA494.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or approval of department.

LA498.name: Internship in Zoo and Aquarium Science
LA498.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LA498.description: Application of zoological experience in a zoo or aquarium setting outside the university.
LA498.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of department.

LA816.name: Environmental Design Theory
LA816.description: Differences between normative theories, scientific theories, models, and constructs. Exploration of normative theories related to thesis or practicum.

LA817.name: Environmental Design Studio
LA817.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LA817.description: Development of a student-selected environmental design project in a collaborative setting.

LA883.name: Environmental Design Seminar
LA883.description: Examination of the breadth of environmental design projects. Literature review of focused projects. Development of practicum or thesis proposals.
LA883.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Horticulture or in the School of Planning, Design and Construction.

LA898.name: Master's Thesis Practicum
LA898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LA898.description: Detailed professional application of a student-selected environmental design project.
LA898.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Environmental Design major.

LA899.name: Master's Thesis Research
LA899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LA899.description: Preparation and completion of an independent research thesis.
LA899.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Environmental Design major.
